trans-unit.source: Provides metadata for a property representing a data field.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use the DataObjectFieldAttribute attribute to provide information about the schema of the underlying data.

Design-time classes such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ObjectDataSourceDesigner> class use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute to set properties at design-time based on the exposed schema.

You apply the DataObjectFieldAttribute attribute to members of the data item objects that are returned by the Select method of an object marked with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute.

In the following example, the `NorthwindData` class is marked with the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectAttribute> attribute, and returns an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> object containing `NorthwindEmployee` objects from the `GetAllEmployees` method.
Fields in the `NorthwindEmployee` class are marked with the DataObjectFieldAttribute attribute to indicate they represent data fields in the underlying data source.
For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute"></xref> class and indicates whether the field is the primary key for the data row.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is in the primary key of the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute"></xref> class and indicates whether the field is the primary key for the data row, and whether the field is a database identity field.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is in the primary key of the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is an identity field that uniquely identifies the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute"></xref> class and indicates whether the field is the primary key for the data row, whether the field is a database identity field, and whether the field can be null.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is in the primary key of the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is an identity field that uniquely identifies the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field can be null in the data store; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute"></xref> class and indicates whether the field is the primary key for the data row, whether it is a database identity field, and whether it can be null and sets the length of the field.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is in the primary key of the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field is an identity field that uniquely identifies the data row; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to indicate that the field can be null in the data store; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The length of the field in bytes.
Returns a value indicating whether this instance is equal to a specified object.
This method determines whether this instance of <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> fits the pattern of another object.
An object to compare with this instance of <xref href="System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute"></xref>.
if this instance is the same as the instance specified by the obj parameter; otherwise, .
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
Gets a value indicating whether a property represents an identity field in the underlying data.
Set the IsIdentity property to `true` when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to a property that represents an identity field in the underlying data store.
Typically an identity field is generated by the data store and uniquely identifies an entity in the data store.
Set the IsIdentity property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property represents an identity field in the underlying data; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default value is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether a property represents a field that can be null in the underlying data store.

Set the IsNullable property to `true` when then <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to a property that represents a field in the underlying data store that can be set to null.
The value that represents null in the data store may be different from `null` in the programming language.
Set the IsNullable property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property represents a field that can be null in the underlying data store; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the length of the property in bytes.
Set the Length property to the length, in bytes, of the data from the underlying data store.
If the Length property is not set, it will be -1.
Set the Length property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.
The length of the property in bytes, or -1 if not set.
Gets a value indicating whether a property is in the primary key in the underlying data.
Set the PrimaryKey property to `true` when the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> attribute is applied to a property that represents the primary key value of the underlying data.
The primary key is typically used by the underlying data store to uniquely identify an entity in the data store, and often is, but is not required to be, a data store identity field.
Set the PrimaryKey property with one of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.DataObjectFieldAttribute> constructors.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the property is in the primary key of the data store; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
